question.questionA: Leaves  petiolate; petals rounded; lobes of sepals reflexed, often caducous; petals and sepals forming a  hypanthium; pedicel at least half as long as capsule; seeds glabrous.
question.questionB: Leaves  sessi le; petals notched; sepals erect, persistent; petals and sepals free; pedicel less than a quarter the length of the capsule; seeds with a plume of hairs.

question.questionA: Stem with two or four ridges or wings, without glandular hairs; stigma entire, club-shaped.
question.questionB: Stem terete, bearing glandular hairs; stigma four-lobed.

question.questionA: Leaves 6-12 cm, somewhat  clasping  and  slightly  decurrent; petals more than 1 cm, deep pink.
question.questionB: Leaves 3-7 cm, neither clasping nor decurrent; petals less than 1 cm, pale pink.
